explanation-en-US:
# üóìÔ∏è Project Deadline (Modals)

Modals express obligation, possibility, and politeness.

1. **[must]**: Obligation.
2. **[might]**: Possibility.
3. **[Could]**: Polite request.
4. **[must]**: Logic deduction.
5. **[should]**: Advice.
6. **[can't]**: Logical impossibility.

title: Ability
content: I [can|must] swim. She [can|should] speak French. Birds [can|should] fly. Fish [cannot|must not] walk.

title: Permission
content: [May|Must] I come in? You [can|must] go now. [Could|Should] I borrow a pen? You [may|must] sit here.

title: Advice
content: You [should|can] study hard. He [should|may] see a doctor. We [should not|cannot] eat too much. They [ought to|can] help.

title: Obligation
content: I [must|can] finish this. You [must|might] stop here. We [have to|can] go. She [has to|may] work.

title: Prohibition
content: You [must not|don't have to] smoke here. You [cannot|don't have to] swim here. We [must not|need not] be late. She [must not|don't have to] tell.

title: Possibility
content: It [might|must] rain later. He [may|must] come. She [could|should] be right. They [might|will] be late.

title: Past Ability
content: I [could|can] run fast when I was young. She [could|can] read at age 5. We [could not|cannot] see it yesterday.

title: Deduction
content: He works hard, he [must|can] be tired. The lights are off, they [must|should] be out. It is glowing, it [cannot|must] be fake.
explanation-zh-TW: Must = Sure true. Cannot = Sure false.

title: No Obligation
content: You [don't have to|must not] go if you don't want to. She [doesn't need to|must not] pay. We [don't have to|must not] hurry.

title: Offers
content: [Shall|Will] I help you? [Can|Must] I get you a drink? [Would|Will] you like coffee? [Shall|Will] we dance?

title: Polite Requests
content: [Could|Must] you help me? [Would|Should] you mind opening the door? [Can|Must] you pass the salt?

title: Past Regret
content: I [should have|could have] studied harder (but I didn't). You [should have|must have] told me. We [should not have|cannot have] gone.

title: Habitual Past
content: We [would|could] play in the park every Sunday. I [used to|use to] live there. He [would|should] always smile.

title: Suggestion
content: We [could|should] go to the cinema. You [might|must] want to try this. Shall we [go|to go]?

title: Interviews
content: You [should|can] dress neatly. You [must|might] arrive on time. You [can|must] ask questions. You [should not|must not] lie.

title: Future Dreams
content: I [might|must] travel the world. I [hope to|must] see Paris. I [can|must] learn Japanese. It [would|should] be amazing.

title: Driving School
content: You [must|can] wear a seatbelt. You [can't|mustn't] speed. You [should|might] look at the mirrors. You [must|can] stop at red lights.

title: At the Doctor
content: You [should|must] drink more water. You [must not|don't have to] eat junk food. You [could|must] try these vitamins. You [should|may] rest.

title: Making Plans
content: [Shall|Must] we meet at 6? [Could|Should] you bring some snacks? I [might|must] be a bit late. We [can|must] watch a movie.

title: Rules in the Lab
content: You [must|can] wear goggles. You [must not|don't have to] eat here. [May|Must] I use this tool? You [should|can] be careful.

title: Past Regrets 2
content: I [should have|could have] called her. I [shouldn't have|can't have] said that. She [must have|might have] been angry. We [could have|must have] won.

title: Strong Advice
content: You [had better|can] study now. You [had better not|must not] forget. He [had better|could] be ready. We [had better|may] leave.

title: Logical Conclusion
content: She is crying, she [must|can] be sad. He is smiling, he [must|should] be happy. The ground is wet, it [must|can] have rained. They are late, they [might|must] have missed the bus.

title: Permission 2
content: [Can|Must] I use your phone? [Could|Should] I open the window? [May|Must] I sit here? You [can|must] borrow my pen.

title: Expectation
content: The train [should|can] arrive soon. He [should|must] be home by now. It [should|might] be a nice day. They [should|can] be here.

title: Necessity
content: I [need to|can] buy milk. She [needs to|must] work. We [don't need to|must not] hurry. Do you [need to|must] go?

title: Preferences
content: I [would rather|could] stay home. She [would rather|can] eat pizza. I [would rather not|must not] go out. [Would|Could] you rather walk?

title: Willingness
content: I [will|shall] help you. She [won't|mustn't] listen. [Will|Shall] you open the door? We [will|can] try again.

title: Critique
content: You [could|must] have told me! He [might|can] have helped. They [should|must] have known. I [could|can] have died!
